data.title: Residential Projects
data.meta_description: As Edmonton grows to a city of 2 million people, the Cityâ€™s Land Development team plans, designs and delivers residential land for sale in greenfield and infill neighbourhoods to increase the housing stock and encourage housing affordability.
data.text:
Athlone - Housing

Neighbourhood

Athlone

Addresses

13007 128 Avenue NW

This project rezoned portions of 13107 - 128 Avenue, 13023 - 128 Avenue, 13019 128 Avenue and 13007 - 128 Avenue, from AJ (Alternative Jurisdiction Zone) and AP (Public Parks Zone) to RA7 (Low Rise Apartment Zone) and AP (Public Parks Zone), and closed the N-S 130 Avenue road right-of-way into 2 parts, to be consolidated with the proposed subdivided parcels, to create 1 multi-family lot and 1 large park site. The intent to allow for a multi-unit affordable or supportive housing development and to designate the remainder of the area as park.

Milestone

The rezoning (Charter Bylaw 20617) and road closure (Bylaw 20616) were approved by City Council on November 20, 2023. The below-market sale was approved by Executive Committee on December 6, 2023.

For More Information

Affordable Housing Developments

Project Phase: Sales

Exhibition Lands Redevelopment

Neighbourhood

Edmonton Northlands

Addresses

7424 118 Avenue; 7300 116 Avenue; 7203 116 Avenue; 11203 73 Street; 11404 80 Street

Edmonton Exhibition Lands is a major transformative redevelopment project in the heart of northeast Edmonton. The area will be redeveloped in phases to create a vibrant, safe, accessible, sustainable and inclusive urban community with a mix of commercial, residential and open space uses.

Parcels 1A and 1B are currently being subdivided for sale.

For More Information

Edmonton Exhibition Lands

Project Phase: Planning

Goodridge Corners Development

Neighbourhood

Goodridge Corners

Addresses

17515 142 Street NW; 18350 127 Street NW; 18503 132 Street NW; 18523 127 Street NW; 18724 142 Street NW; 18732 142 Street NW

The City owns approximately 61 acres of commercial and industrial land and 243 acres of residential land which will be developed over 16 phases in this neighbourhood. In order to progress development, the City will be submitting an amendment to the Goodridge Corners NASP in 2024.

Phase 3 will be subdivided to make way for 112 units of Residential Mixed Dwelling development. Design will occur in Q2 of 2023.

Milestone

The Phase 3 Rezoning (Charter Bylaw 20465) was approved by City Council on May 15, 2023.

Project Phase: Planning

Heritage Valley Town Centre Development

Neighbourhood

Heritage Valley Town Centre

Addresses

3150 127 Street SW; 2910 127 Street SW; 2704 127 Street SW

The City owns approximately 119 acres of land in Heritage Valley Town Center. 55 acres will be dedicated as municipal reserve for the District Park and the remainder is planned for a storm water management facility, future LRT alignment, utility lots and a mix of commercial and high density residential.

Servicing design has been ongoing for the saleable lots, school site and the park. The City started grading in 2022. The remainder of construction expected to start in Q2 2023 with completion in 2024.

Milestones

Rezoning (Charter Bylaw 20324) and the associated amendments to the Heritage Valley NASP (Bylaw 20323) were approved by City Council on December 6, 2022.

Project Phase: Delivery

Pleasantview - Residential Development

Neighbourhood

Pleasantview

Addresses

11010 60 Avenue; 11015 60 Avenue

Redevelopment of two RF1 Single Family Lots, to create five Low Density Infill Zone (RF2) lots and one Small Scale Infill Development (RF3) zone for sale in a future public property offering. Working alongside Building Great Neighbourhoods, servicing construction is anticipated to begin in Q3 2023.

Milestones

Rezoning (Charter Bylaw 19937) was approved by Council on January 23, 2023.

Project Phase: Delivery

River Crossing - Redevelopment

Neighbourhood

Rossdale

Address

1233 96 Avenue

River Crossing is the transformational redevelopment of West Rossdale. This project will see the creation of new public spaces that support our connection to and through the river valley, celebrate 10,000 years of Indigenous placemaking and gathering, and invest in the rehabilitation and reuse of the historic Rossdale Power Plant.

Land Development will advance the community redevelopment components of the River Crossing vision including investments in the transportation network and upgrading servicing to enhance connectivity and catalyze private investment that will see the creation of up to 2,654 new households. River Crossing is guided by the Council-approved River Crossing Business Plan and Heritage Interpretive Plan.

Milestones

A council report related to the governance structure that includes Indigenous communities with historic ties to Ross Flats was presented to the Executive Committee on June 23, 2023. The report was received for information.

Project Phase: Analysis
